intro: Palicourea manaraeana, commonly known as the Manaraeana shrub, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
